intro: Lepicystis friedrichsthaliana, commonly known as the Friedrichsthal's lepicystis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lepicystis friedrichsthaliana is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
